# Banking Act 1979

|related_legislation=
|repealing_legislation=Banking Act 1987 s108(2)
|status=Repealed
|original_text=http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1979/37/contents/enacted
|legislation_history=
|revised_text=http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1979/37/contents
|}}
The Banking Act 1979 (c. 37) was an act of the Parliament of the United Kingdom enacted in the wake of the secondary banking crisis of 1973â€“1975 to extend the Bank of England's regulatory powers over lenders (banks) and to provide protections for their depositors.
See also
*UK banking law
*UK public service law
